definitions.definition: A sensation of dryness in the throat associated with a craving for liquids, produced by deprivation of drink, or by some other cause (such as fear, excitement, etc.) which stops the secretion of the pharyngeal mucous membrane .
examples: We developed a great thirst during our hike.
He had quite a thirst on and so headed to his favourite Dublin pub.

definitions.definition: The condition producing the sensation of thirst.
examples: If you go out in the desert for long without water, the thirst can drive you mad.

definitions.definition: A want and eager desire (for something); a craving or longing .
examples: She had a real thirst for news and that greatly helped her career.
He had a thirst for her and she had the same for him.

main_definition: A sensation of dryness in the throat associated with a craving for liquids, produced by deprivation of drink, or by some other cause (such as fear, excitement, etc.) which stops the secretion of the pharyngeal mucous membrane .
secondary_definitions: The condition producing the sensation of thirst.
( figuratively ) A want and eager desire (for something); a craving or longing .
